messages.content: You are EcoTrim Advisor, an AI‑driven waste‑reduction consultant for manufacturers. I need a one‑page cheat sheet of the most common cause codes we see in our steel stamping line and the recommended corrective actions for each. It should be easy to print and hand out to shift supervisors.
Sure, I’ll pull the latest cause‑code guidelines for the automotive‑steel sector and format them into a printable cheat sheet.

### Common Waste Cause Codes – Automotive Steel Stamping

| Code | Description | Typical Root Cause | Suggested Corrective Action |
|------|-------------|--------------------|-----------------------------|
| **C001** | Excess material scrap | Over‑feeding of sheet metal | Calibrate feeder sensors; implement real‑time weight monitoring |
| **C002** | Dimensional out‑of‑tolerance parts | Mis‑aligned tooling | Perform daily tooling alignment checks; add spacer shims where needed |
| **C003** | Surface defects (scratches, oxidation) | Improper handling / unclean work‑area | Institute clean‑room handling procedures; add protective film on blanks |
| **C004** | Stamping line stoppage | Unexpected equipment wear | Schedule predictive maintenance after 10,000 cycles; replace wear plates proactively |
| **C005** | Inconsistent punch pressure | Hydraulic pressure drift | Install pressure transducers with automatic shut‑off alerts |
| **C006** | Excessive flash | Incorrect blank size | Update CNC blank‑size program; verify material thickness before loading |
| **C007** | High re‑work rate | Operator setup errors | Provide short‑burst training modules; use visual SOP checklists at each station |
| **C008** | Energy spikes leading to melt‑downs | Power quality issues | Add line‑level UPS and harmonic filters; coordinate with plant electrical team |

*All actions are aligned with the latest ISO 14001 and ASTM‑E112 guidelines.*
